climbs.name: White Rock to Whiskey Springs Endurance Traverse (link)

content.description:
Start on the Main Wall at White Rock Acres, traverse (right to left or east to west) the main wall near the ground moving up or down as needed. Once completed (100+ft of climbing) move to the White Wall and traverse the entire thing (100ft+) from east to west (closest to farthest on the trail).  

  Once that traverse is complete hit the trail (heading west away from Main Wall) until you hit the Appalachian Trail (AT). Take a left at the AT and follow all the way until you hit Whiskey Springs (+/- 4 miles).  

  Traverse around the Vulture View Area (theres a V3 established traverse already if youd like to follow that, check out Whiskey Springs on Mountainproject.com for more details) and climb whatever routes you wish THEN hit the trail going back. 

  Total of 10 + miles and some great endurance and technique (variety) training. 

  Can be done solo very easily or with friends or dogs.
content.location: Start at the White Rock Acre trailhead/parking lot and end there as well.

content.description: Sidewinder is a free solo route that follows the sloping crack that starts at the base of the tree, continues east to west along the mid-wall ledge, and then up to the top on the western edge with substantial hand and footholds.
content.location: If you walk down to the base of the wall from the east, the route begins at the foot of the second tree against the wall.

content.description: Crux is the lower section directly up through, and just above, the dark smear. Continue up a fairly easy section above that.
content.protection: Large pine at the top of the route may be used for TR anchor, if you want to use a rope.
content.location: Left end of Main Wall at the section that had graffiti, but has been cleaned.  Walk/Scramble up and off to the left.

content.description: Start about four feet right of Maddie's Dark Side.  Climb the prominent left angled crack that leads up then angles a bit right.
content.protection: Large pine tree at the top of the route may be used as TR anchor, if you want to use a rope.
content.location: Main Wall - Left side at the section that had graffiti, but has been cleaned. Start about 4 feet right of Maddie's Dark Side and about 4 feet left of a small tree near the base.  Walk/Scramble up and off to the left.

content.description: Two feet right of Maddie. Start straight up a triangular block to a small crack leading up to a fairly easy, blocky section near the top.
content.protection: Large pine tree at the top may be used for a TR anchor, if you want to use a rope.
content.location: Main Wall - Left side at the section that had graffiti, but has been cleaned. Two feet right of Maddie, and about two feet left of a small tree near the base. Walk/Scramble up and off to the left.

content.description:
60ft of plenty of different types of placement opportunities (many varied cracks). Ledges are around but you can avoid most by being creative in choosing your line.  

  The center and right side of the Main Wall (which faces South) no matter what path(s) you choose will be no harder than 5.4/5.5. The left side of the Main Wall has some harder lines but no harder than 5.7/5.8.  

  People have been climbing here I'm told since at least the 1940s.
